trans-unit.source: Contains information about a single data-binding expression in an ASP.NET server control, which allows rapid-application development (RAD) designers, such as Microsoft Visual Studio, to create data-binding expressions at design time.
This class cannot be inherited.
Each data-binding expression in a server control is represented at design time by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinding> class.
Any server control that contains one or more data-binding expressions has a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection> object that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinding> objects.
This collection is accessible through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataBindingsAccessor> interface.
When you create a custom RAD designer, use that implementation to access the collection.
Any <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinding> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection> objects associated with a server control exist only at design time.
They do not exist at run time and, therefore, are not accessible during run time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataBinding"></xref> class.
The property to bind data to.
The .NET Framework type of the property to bind data to.
The data-binding expression to be evaluated.
Determines whether the specified object is the same instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataBinding"></xref> class as the current object.
The object to compare against the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataBinding"></xref>.
`true` if the data-binding property names match; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the data-binding expression to be evaluated.
The data-binding expression to be evaluated.
Retrieves the hash code for an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataBinding"></xref> object.
<xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinding> objects are placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection> object, accessible only at design time.
The collection is a hash table that represents the bindings on a control.

There can only be one binding per property, so the hash code computation matches the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinding.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> implementation and only takes the property name into account.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets the name of the ASP.NET server control property to bind data to.
The property to bind data to.
Gets the .NET Framework type of the data-bound ASP.NET server control property.
The .NET Framework type of the data-bound property.
